commented_code:
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+
+    <groupId>org.nd4j</groupId>
+    <artifactId>nd4j-benchmark</artifactId>
+    <version>0.1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
+    <packaging>jar</packaging>
+
+    <name>ND4J Benchmarks</name>
+
+    <!--
+       This is the demo/sample template build script for building Java benchmarks with JMH.
+       Edit as needed.
+    -->
+
+    <prerequisites>
+        <maven>3.0</maven>
+    </prerequisites>
+
+    <repositories>
+        <repository>
+            <id>snapshots-repo</id>
+            <url>https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots</url>
+            <releases>
+                <enabled>false</enabled>
+            </releases>
+            <snapshots>
+                <enabled>true</enabled>
+                <updatePolicy>daily</updatePolicy>  <!-- Optional, update daily -->
+            </snapshots>
+        </repository>
+        <repository>
+            <id>clojars</id>
+            <url>http://clojars.org/repo/</url>
+            <releases>
+                <enabled>true</enabled>
+            </releases>
+            <snapshots>
+                <enabled>true</enabled>
+                <updatePolicy>daily</updatePolicy>  <!-- Optional, update daily -->
+            </snapshots>
+        </repository>
+    </repositories>
+
+    <properties>
+        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
+        <jmh.version>1.33</jmh.version>
+        <javac.target>1.8</javac.target>
+        <uberjar.name>benchmarks</uberjar.name>
+        <maven.compiler.source>1.8</maven.compiler.source>
+        <maven.compiler.target>1.8</maven.compiler.target>
+        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
+        <nd4j.version>1.0.0-SNAPSHOT</nd4j.version>
+    </properties>
+
+
+    <dependencies>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.bytedeco</groupId>
+            <artifactId>openblas</artifactId>
+            <version>0.3.17-1.5.6</version>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.openjdk.jmh</groupId>
+            <artifactId>jmh-generator-annprocess</artifactId>
+            <version>1.33</version>

discussion_comments.comment_body: @saudet  ah good catch, jackson-core and databind are both at 2.12.2. Just pushed the change there.
Create a separate version maybe jboss.netty3.version and io.netty?
Also try to force a dependency on the same version of JavaCPP as used in the rest of Deeplearning4j.
Also try to force a dependency on the same version of JavaCPP as used in the rest of Deeplearning4j.
At this moment that's not our code, and as I see in maven central - 0.4 is the only available version at this moment.
No, but newer versions of ND4J will not work with an old version of JavaCPP, while an old version of JFastText *might* work with a new version of JavaCPP.

discussion_comments.comment_body:
Mind adding dependency versions under dependency management in the top level pom? We do this to avoid dependency conflicts across modules.
Do this with 
<dependency>
            <groupId>org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets</groupId>
            <artifactId>cpython-platform</artifactId>
            <version>3.6-1.4.4-SNAPSHOT</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency> 


converting to:
<dependency>
            <groupId>org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets</groupId>
            <artifactId>cpython-platform</artifactId>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>\

putting the previous declaration under a dependency management section.

Also, please version the python and javacpp versions with variables at the top level.
1.4.4 has been released, so we can remove the SNAPSHOT bit! And actually just use `${javacpp-presets.version}` to have it take the same version as all the other presets.

discussion_comments.comment_body: I wonder if a <dependencyManagement> entry would be better here?
Using project.version or project.parent.version can cause issues, so let's use datavec.version, etc and such in all those places.
